questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is the central idea of justice?
questionList.choiceA: Equal treatment of people
questionList.choiceC: Treating people as they deserve
questionList.choiceD: Treating people discriminately

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is an indicator of poverty in a given country?
questionList.choiceA: Rapid economic development
questionList.choiceC: Prevalence of illiteracy
questionList.choiceD: Adequacy of social services

questionList.questionStatement: The Regional States in the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia can exercise several functions, which include.
questionList.choiceA: Collecting taxes and revenues with the state
questionList.choiceB: Granting passport and determining issues of nationality
questionList.choiceC: Establishing national defense and security force
questionList.choiceD: Formulating and implementing foreign relation policies

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following statements is true about constitution of a democratic state?
questionList.choiceA: It is formulated to protect the rights and benefits of rulers
questionList.choiceB: It is formulated to reinforce the power of the ruling class
questionList.choiceC: It minimizes the relations between state organs and citizens
questionList.choiceD: It contains principles that put a limit to the power of government

questionList.questionStatement: In Ethiopia special efforts should be made to enhance the social, political and economic equality of women with men, because failure to respect gender equality will
questionList.choiceA: facilitate the development of the country without the participation of women in development activities.
questionList.choiceB: Hinder the development of the country as it discourages the participation of women in development activities
questionList.choiceC: Encourages men to make devoted participation in development activities and take large share of the benefits
questionList.choiceD: Eradicate the traditional rule of femininity that dictates women 's dominant right of inheritance over men

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about HIV?
questionList.choiceA: It can cause immediate death of a person right upon getting infected
questionList.choiceB: It often enters a healthy person 's body through the mouth and the skin
questionList.choiceC: It can be transmitted from person to person by sharing a toilet seat
questionList.choiceD: It weakens the natural protection of an infected person 's body against illness

questionList.questionStatement: As a responsible high school student, the roles you should play in the common front against HIV/AIDS include
questionList.choiceA: Rejecting medical treatments involving blood transfusions
questionList.choiceB: Avoiding social relations with individuals infected by the virus
questionList.choiceC: Dropping out of school in order to take care of sick family member
questionList.choiceD: Refraining from engagement in any form of sexual intercourse

questionList.questionStatement: In a democratic system no person may be arrested or detained without the decision of the court, this means that every person has
questionList.choiceA: the Right to Arrest
questionList.choiceC: The right to Security
questionList.choiceD: the Right to Liberty

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following traditional practices have contributed to the low level of saving in our country?
questionList.choiceA: Lack of modern financial institutions for saving
questionList.choiceB: Extravagant expenditure on social and religious celebrations
questionList.choiceC: Little awareness and usage of family planning
questionList.choiceD: Low consumption expenditure in subsistence sector

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following pairs represents a paradox in Ethiopia in relation to saving
questionList.choiceA: Family planning and checking population growth
questionList.choiceC: Economic growth and a high rate of investment
questionList.choiceD: Population growth and a high rate of birth

questionList.questionStatement: Patriotic feelings among citizens in a democratic nation mainly contributes to
questionList.choiceA: Work for the common good
questionList.choiceB: Love of the landscape of one 's nation
questionList.choiceC: The promotion of racism
questionList.choiceD: Wage war to protect one 's leader

questionList.questionStatement: Expenses which are meant to serve ons wants rather than needs belong to
questionList.choiceA: monthly expenses
questionList.choiceC: Fixed expenses
questionList.choiceD: Annual expenses

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following laws is enacted by the legislative body of the FDRE
questionList.choiceA: international law
questionList.choiceC: Divine law
questionList.choiceD: Statue law

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following circumstances is destructive to the common good?
questionList.choiceA: making joint eforts to solve common problems
questionList.choiceC: refraining from communicating state secrets to a third party
questionList.choiceD: developing intolerance towards religious and linguistic differences

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is an example of personality rights? The right
questionList.choiceA: to hold opinions
questionList.choiceC: To life
questionList.choiceD: To form association

questionList.questionStatement: Ahmed likes reading poems, short stories and novels very much. This means he reads for
questionList.choiceA: Exploring
questionList.choiceC: enjoyment
questionList.choiceD: Searching facts

questionList.questionStatement: A mechanism of preventing pregnancy with the help of different devices an drugs is referred to as
questionList.choiceA: conception
questionList.choiceC: pregnancy taste
questionList.choiceD: Reproduction

questionList.questionStatement: Civic participation refers to
questionList.choiceA: The role competent citizens should play in the social, political economic life of their community
questionList.choiceB: The commitment responsible citizens should show to achieve the highest political authority in their community
questionList.choiceC: The democratic right of citizens to resist the government 's call for national military service
questionList.choiceD: The commitment a democratic government should show in equal distribution of benefits to citizens of the country

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is considered as a major cause of corruption committed by government officials?
questionList.choiceA: Having no or little concern for others
questionList.choiceB: Aspiration to get what they deserve
questionList.choiceC: The disparity between the knowledge and salaries of officials
questionList.choiceD: The influence of family member

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following acts has a negative impact on industriousness?
questionList.choiceA: Entrepreneurial work
questionList.choiceC: rent seeking
questionList.choiceD: Affective commitment

questionList.questionStatement: Hawi is very proud and happy to be an athlete. She has participated in many running contests. Now she is ready to take part in the 2008 Beijing Olympic; she believes that she will win a gold medal in the 3000 meters category. This shows that Hawi has high
questionList.choiceA: self-reliance
questionList.choiceC: Self-importance
questionList.choiceD: Self-concept

questionList.questionStatement: The level of community participation in a democratic system, which allows each community to identify its own problems, assess its options and carry out its decisions, is called
questionList.choiceA: Middle level community participation
questionList.choiceC: Minimum level community participation
questionList.choiceD: Full level community participation

questionList.questionStatement: The social, economic and political status of women in Ethiopia is lower than that of men. Which of the following is the major cause of this gender inequality?
questionList.choiceA: The physical weakness and strength of women and men, respectively
questionList.choiceB: The biological and physical difference between women and men
questionList.choiceC: The unjust natural superiority of men in their intelligence to women
questionList.choiceD: The wrong beliefs and assumptions we hold about women and men

questionList.questionStatement: In the economic sense, the term work is defined as
questionList.choiceA: The mechanism of operating a machine
questionList.choiceB: A valuable activities its end-result is a product
questionList.choiceC: Making use of mental power in order to make something,
questionList.choiceD: The use of force to produce mass through space

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following statement correctly characterizes a responsible person? A responsible person
questionList.choiceA: Knows how to make a crime and avoid accountability
questionList.choiceB: Knows what is expected of her/him and acts accordingly
questionList.choiceC: Will never blame herself/himself and be accountable for her/his faults
questionList.choiceD: Will never commit any crime and be held accountable

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following explains the nature of intellectual pursuits?
questionList.choiceA: The end result of the intellectual process is the acquisition of pure knowledge
questionList.choiceB: Information involves elevating oneself through knowledge, values and reason
questionList.choiceC: When knowledge includes values
questionList.choiceD: Awareness of the cognitive representation of data represents the final step in the spectrum of knowledge

questionList.questionStatement: Until recently, the history of Ethiopia was characterized by
questionList.choiceA: emphasizing the importance of studying the cultures of the diverse nations, nationalities and peoples of Ethiopia .
questionList.choiceB: Paying little attention to foreign writers ' accounts of political religious and commercial affairs
questionList.choiceC: little focus on documenting political activities and achievements of the ruling class
questionList.choiceD: chauvinistic attitudes towards the diverse nations, nationalities and peoples of Ethiopia

questionList.questionStatement: Suppose there is a wide-spread racial discrimination in your school, in what way can you help to stop the problem?
questionList.choiceA: Organizing a group of students to be engaged in a counter hateful propaganda against the racists
questionList.choiceB: Waiting for the government to act against the racist groups and their racist actions
questionList.choiceC: Forming a group to non-violently confront the racists and their racist actions
questionList.choiceD: Joining a group of students engaged in stereotyping and stigmatizing the racists

questionList.questionStatement: The principal purpose of FDRE government in relation to nations, nationalities and people of Ethiopia is to ensure
questionList.choiceA: Religious unity
questionList.choiceC: Homogeneity of culture
questionList.choiceD: Political independence

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is true about the impact of HIV/AIDS?
questionList.choiceA: The fatality of HIV/AIDS is similar with other diseases
questionList.choiceB: The major impact of HIV/AIDS at the family level are economic and social
questionList.choiceC: The education sector of a country is least affected by the HIV/AIDS epidemic
questionList.choiceD: HIV/AIDS mainly affected the non-productive age-group in society.

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following describes best the attitude of self-reliant individuals towards criticism? For self-reliant people
questionList.choiceA: Excessive self-criticism undermines one 's motivation to work
questionList.choiceC: Criticisms from friends and family members are unacceptable
questionList.choiceD: Decisions are always based on reactions from others

questionList.questionStatement: When citizens in a democracy actively participate in periodic elections, they are
questionList.choiceA: Wasting their invaluable time by involving in a political game
questionList.choiceB: Exercising their right and responsibility to establish their government
questionList.choiceC: Showing their loyalty and respect to their government
questionList.choiceD: Fulfilling their obligations to subordinate themselves to their rulers

questionList.questionStatement: Ethiopia is one of the poorest countries in the world, this situation can be changed by
questionList.choiceA: Securing large amount of economic and food aid from rich countries
questionList.choiceB: Seeking a continuous assistance of the western countries for a century
questionList.choiceC: Devoted participation of citizens in economic and political activities
questionList.choiceD: Avoiding traditional modes and means of production in the country

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is true about the main source of law in a democratic nation?
questionList.choiceA: Popular sovereignty is the fundamental source law
questionList.choiceB: The sovereign rules plays a decisive role in formulating supreme law
questionList.choiceC: The supreme Being is the basic of law
questionList.choiceD: Custom is the major source of law

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is a political right of citizens of FDRE?
questionList.choiceA: participating in decision making meetings and functions of the religions bodies
questionList.choiceB: Playing a significant role in shaping the government institutions and laws of the country
questionList.choiceC: involving in various activities and opposition parties aimed at dominating h state power
questionList.choiceD: having access to state secrets and revealing them to others without arbitrary restriction

questionList.questionStatement: Saving is a very important habit you should develop early in your life, because it helps you.
questionList.choiceA: To multiply opportunities for spending your money
questionList.choiceB: To maximize the expenditure of your money
questionList.choiceC: To cover the costs of your future goals
questionList.choiceD: To minimizes your material needs

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following principles of democracy allows all Ethiopian citizens of 18 and above equal right to elect and to be elected in periodic elections?
questionList.choiceA: Free election
questionList.choiceC: Universal Suffrage
questionList.choiceD: Majority rule

questionList.questionStatement: The fundamental law of a country, which establishes basic organs of government, and defines the structure, powers, functions, and the interrelationships of these organs, is known as
questionList.choiceA: justice system
questionList.choiceC: Rule of law
questionList.choiceD: legislature

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following ancient rules was alleged to be the ancestor of the Christian autocratic monarchs of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Iyasu I
questionList.choiceC: Yikuno Amlak
questionList.choiceD: Solomon

questionList.questionStatement: The constitution of FDRE recognizes the equality of nations, nationalities and peoples of Ethiopia for the distribution of social services, this means that there should be
questionList.choiceA: Fair distribution of services such as schooling, electricity, telecommunication and health care
questionList.choiceB: Equal distribution of the accumulated wealthy and natural resources of the country
questionList.choiceC: Equal obligation of citizens to pay equal taxes to get access to social services provided by the government
questionList.choiceD: Allocation of equal economic and natural resources by the government to all citizens

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of following pairs represents the most effective ways of maximizing productivity?
questionList.choiceA: Doing things well and on time
questionList.choiceC: Allocating resources and time in excess
questionList.choiceD: Working randomly and slowly

questionList.questionStatement: People often hesitate to make decisions because they
questionList.choiceA: Do not have the capacity to make decisions
questionList.choiceC: Find it not wise to do so
questionList.choiceD: Are satisfied with what they have already achieved

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is true about the qualities of self-reliant people? Self reliant people
questionList.choiceA: Need help from other most of the time
questionList.choiceB: Overburden themselves with many activities at a time
questionList.choiceC: Are hesitant to defined their views openly
questionList.choiceD: Are ready to criticize their bosses if necessary

questionList.questionStatement: In a society where there is Rule of Law
questionList.choiceA: Higher government officials rule the people according to their good will
questionList.choiceB: Rulers make laws and decide how to govern the people according to their laws
questionList.choiceC: All citizens have equal right and power to interpret and implement the law
questionList.choiceD: All members of the society including government officials act according to accepted rules

questionList.questionStatement: By which of the following ways can rule of law achieve its major purpose limiting governmental power?
questionList.choiceA: Requiring the government to carry out its activities transparently and accountably
questionList.choiceB: Making the government officials to rule the people according to their laws
questionList.choiceC: Enabling the people to exercise their rights to equal share of government
questionList.choiceD: Protecting the freedom of government officials to conduct their duties according to their free will

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is an important data correction instrument?
questionList.choiceA: Newspaper
questionList.choiceC: information
questionList.choiceD: Commonsense

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is true about the nature of Rule of Law in a democratic nation?
questionList.choiceA: Rule of law is mainly based on criminal law
questionList.choiceB: The civil law is the supreme law of the nation
questionList.choiceC: International laws form the bases of rules of law
questionList.choiceD: The constitution is the principal source of rule of law

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is a major feature of unlimited governments?
questionList.choiceA: Provision of unlimited power to citizens
questionList.choiceC: Delegation of power to elected rulers
questionList.choiceD: Separation of powers among different organs of the state

questionList.questionStatement: The field of work in which you will be engaged over a period of years in the future will be your
questionList.choiceA: Job
questionList.choiceC: task
questionList.choiceD: career

questionList.questionStatement: You know that Ethiopia is a country of varied ethnic groups. Cultures
questionList.choiceA: To learn a variety of ways of taking social and economic advantages of people from rich ethnic groups
questionList.choiceB: To develop biases against people from different ethnic groups and holding different beliefs
questionList.choiceC: To form relationships with persons from different cultural backgrounds and be exposed to new viewpoints
questionList.choiceD: To have access to natural resources in possession of other ethnic and religious group

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is true about civic societies? They
questionList.choiceA: Are governed by the supreme law of the land
questionList.choiceB: Are governmental agencies of promoting national unity
questionList.choiceC: Create opportunities for individuals to organize political parties
questionList.choiceD: Have the right to interfere in the internal affairs of the nation

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about the legal equality of citizens according to the FDRE constitution?
questionList.choiceA: Citizens serving the ruling party deserve to the privileged by the law
questionList.choiceB: Citizens of the patriotic records should be favored by the law
questionList.choiceC: All citizens with similar cases are considered as equal before the law
questionList.choiceD: All citizens should be treated according to their social status by the law

questionList.questionStatement: ''Honesty is the best policy, '' the lesson we can draw from this proverb is
questionList.choiceA: The value of truthfulness
questionList.choiceC: the burdens of honesty
questionList.choiceD: The importance of policy

questionList.questionStatement: All citizens have to execute their duties and responsibilities because it is important for
questionList.choiceA: The well-being of the society
questionList.choiceC: Abolishing economic difference
questionList.choiceD: Avoiding social security

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following sources provides an unbiased account of Ethiopian history?
questionList.choiceA: legendary accounts
questionList.choiceC: Travelers ' accounts
questionList.choiceD: eye-witness accounts

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is true about state formation in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: In its territorial extent, the Aksumite empire extended from Shewa in north to Gamo Gofa in the South
questionList.choiceB: The first post-Aksumite Christian empire in Ethiopia was established by Yikunno Amlak
questionList.choiceC: We have precise information about the territorial extent to the kingdom of Damat
questionList.choiceD: Ethiopia in its present-day territorial extent emerged since the beginning of the 20th century A . D

questionList.questionStatement: In the present-day Ethiopia, the government body which has the authority of implementing and enforcing the law is
questionList.choiceA: the executive
questionList.choiceC: The federal
questionList.choiceD: the legislative

questionList.questionStatement: Since 1991, modern Ethiopia has acquired the shape of
questionList.choiceA: An empire state
questionList.choiceC: a multi national state
questionList.choiceD: a unilingual state

questionList.questionStatement: The FDRE constitution vests the authority to establish the Federal High and First Instant courts in
questionList.choiceA: The office of the Prime Minister
questionList.choiceC: The house of the Federation
questionList.choiceD: The ministry of justice

questionList.questionStatement: The ancient Greek philosopher, Socrates, who was brought to trial and condemned to death, accepted his fate on the ground of
questionList.choiceA: respecting national security
questionList.choiceC: standing for the truth
questionList.choiceD: keeping state secret

questionList.questionStatement: Records of facts, figures and such like details that show us something about people, countries, objects, events, etc . is referred to as
questionList.choiceA: data
questionList.choiceC: Analysis
questionList.choiceD: interview

questionList.questionStatement: We fulfill our duties primarily as a mater of obligation to
questionList.choiceA: Our friends
questionList.choiceC: our seniors
questionList.choiceD: our selves

questionList.questionStatement: The state of being informed and able to consciously accomplish something is
questionList.choiceA: knowledge
questionList.choiceC: Research
questionList.choiceD: information

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following features characterizes an unlimited government?
questionList.choiceA: Leaders are free to make decisions that bind the people
questionList.choiceC: Leaders are accountable to the people
questionList.choiceD: Citizens have the right to control their leaders

questionList.questionStatement: Individual develop prejudice against other mainly due to
questionList.choiceA: acceptance
questionList.choiceC: tolerance
questionList.choiceD: compromise

questionList.questionStatement: A form of corruption that is often committed by individuals engaged in auditing and supervision is
questionList.choiceA: Abuse of power
questionList.choiceC: Intrigue
questionList.choiceD: Embezzlement

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is an indispensable factor for leading a meaningful
questionList.choiceA: Economical use of income and materials at home
questionList.choiceB: Maximizing the size of one 's family by having multiple sexual partners
questionList.choiceC: Avoiding expenditures of income on goods and services
questionList.choiceD: Learning to live a luxurious life by maximizing income

questionList.questionStatement: The state structure of Ethiopia before 1994 was mainly
questionList.choiceA: democratic
questionList.choiceC: decentralized
questionList.choiceD: Unitary

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is true about an unwritten constitution in comparison with a written one?
questionList.choiceA: It is more convenient to use
questionList.choiceC: It includes laws enacted by parliament
questionList.choiceD: It is not functional in the contemporary world

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following statement about work and time is correct?
questionList.choiceA: The existence of time depends on a work
questionList.choiceB: The existence of work does not depend on time
questionList.choiceC: Work never exists independent of time
questionList.choiceD: Time does not exist independent of work

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is expected of citizens in democracy to achieve the common good?
questionList.choiceA: Maintaining political dominance
questionList.choiceC: Abolishing ethnic differences
questionList.choiceD: Standing for individual interest

questionList.questionStatement: The state informed and able to consciously accomplish something is
questionList.choiceA: Established mainly to implement government policies
questionList.choiceB: Organized to let citizens take part in cooperative activities
questionList.choiceC: Established as commercial undertaking with international companies
questionList.choiceD: Set up for the sole purpose of building up solidarity among human being

questionList.questionStatement: All of the following are effective ways of conserving energy except
questionList.choiceA: Using fluorescent bulbs
questionList.choiceB: Using fuel wood instead of electricity
questionList.choiceC: Turning off lights sets when falling asleep
questionList.choiceD: Fixing low-wattage bulbs

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about the Federal democratic Republic of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: The federal and state governments have mutually exclusive powers and function
questionList.choiceB: All state powers are given to the central or federal government
questionList.choiceC: The federal government alone shall have legislative. Executive and judicial powers
questionList.choiceD: All members states of the FDRE have equal powers and rights

questionList.questionStatement: A democratic government is accountable to
questionList.choiceA: the court
questionList.choiceC: The people
questionList.choiceD: the police

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is true about gender equality?
questionList.choiceA: All men and women are born equal
questionList.choiceB: Inequalities between men and women are caused by natural
questionList.choiceC: Gender equality has nothing to do with forms of government
questionList.choiceD: Men and women are bigollgically identical

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following principles of democracy allows all Ethiopian Citizens of 18 and above equal right to elect and to be elected in periodic elections?
questionList.choiceA: Fast reading skill and remembering what is read
questionList.choiceB: Detailed memorization and recital of the material read
questionList.choiceC: Proper understanding and utilization of what is read
questionList.choiceD: Judging the value of the material before it is read

questionList.questionStatement: The principle of equality of benefits dictates that all regions should be
questionList.choiceA: granted benefits irrespective of historical factors
questionList.choiceB: treated on the basis of their natural resources
questionList.choiceC: given equal opportunities to utilize their capa
questionList.choiceD: entitled to affirmative action

questionList.questionStatement: One of the essential social and cultural rights of nations nationalities and peoples of FDRE is their right to equal opportunity for education. This right is important to them because it enables them
questionList.choiceA: To enlarge their territorial borders and achieve political dominance
questionList.choiceB: To establish their own defense force and ensure their sovereignty
questionList.choiceC: To satisfy their continuing need for skilled and informed citizens
questionList.choiceD: To reject the federal state and establish their own independent state

questionList.questionStatement: The task of discharging duties on an equal footing is referring to as equality of
questionList.choiceA: benefits
questionList.choiceC: burdens
questionList.choiceD: authority
